Models training package¶

cb_recommend_models module¶

Recommendation models using content based methods.

class booksuggest.models.cb_recommend_models.ContentBasedRecommendationModel(content_analyzer, recommendation_count)[source]¶

Bases: booksuggest.models.cb_recommend_models.ICbRecommendationModel

Recommendation model using text features. Later uses the cosine similarity in order to select the most similar books.

content_analyzer¶

Component used for feature extraction from the data.

filtering_component¶

Component used for calculating most similar books based on the features calculated by the content_analyzer.

recommend(book_id)[source]¶

Based on the user input in form a dictionary containing

The model makes use of tf-idf features calculated using book descriptions. The cosine metric is used in order to determine which books are similar.

Return type:Dict[int, float]
train(book_data)[source]¶

Prepares feature vectors.

class booksuggest.models.cb_recommend_models.ICbRecommendationModel[source]¶

Bases: object

Interface for content based recommendation models.

recommend(book_id)[source]¶

Recommends books similar to the given book.

Parameters:book_id (int) – Id of the book for which recommendations would be given.
Returns:Dictionary composed of book ids and their distances from the original book key value pairs.
Return type:Dict[int, float]
train(book_data)[source]¶

Trains the content based recommendation model.

Parameters:book_data (DataFrame) – Data frame containing book data, composed of the following columns: book_id, authors, original_publication_year, original_title, title, isbn13, description.

content_analyzer module¶

Content analyzers used by content based recommendation models.

Content analyzers are objects that extract features from the items of interest. They play a main part in content based recommendation systems.

class booksuggest.models.content_analyzer.ContentAnalyzerBuilder(name, ngrams=None, tag_features=None)[source]¶

Bases: object

Builder class used for creating content analyzers based on the given configuration.

Parameters:
  • name (str) – Type of the content analyzer.
  • ngram – Maximal number of words in a single feature.
  • tag_features (Optional[DataFrame]) – Data frame containing calculated tag features.
build_content_analyzer()[source]¶

Build a content analyzer based on the object configuration.

Return type:IContentAnalyzer
class booksuggest.models.content_analyzer.EnsembledContentAnalyzer(content_analyzers)[source]¶

Bases: booksuggest.models.content_analyzer.IContentAnalyzer

Content analyzer that creates feature vectors composed of both text features and tag features.

text_content_analyzer¶

Content analyzer repsonsible for extracting text features.

tag_features¶

Path to tag based features.

build_features(book_data)[source]¶

Builds feature matrix for the book_data data frame.

Return type:ndarray
get_feature_vector(book_id)[source]¶

Returns the feature vector of a specific book.

Parameters:book_id – Specifies the book for which the feature vector will be returned.
Returns:Feature vector of the given book.

tf_idf_models script¶

Command used for creating different types of content based recommendation models.

booksuggest.models.tf_idf_models.main(input_filepath, output_filepath, rec_count, ngrams, name, tag_features_filepath)¶

Main script used for training content based recommendation models.

Parameters:
  • input_filepath – Path to file containg training data.
  • output_filepath – Path to file in which the trained model should be saved.
  • rec_count – Specifies how many recommendations the model should return.
  • ngrams – Specifies the ngram range used when extracting text features.
  • name – Type of the model to train.
  • tag_features_filepath –
  • to file containing precalculated tag features. (Path) –

cf_recommend_models module¶

class booksuggest.models.cf_recommend_models.ICfRecommendationModel[source]¶

Bases: object

generate_antitest_set()[source]¶

Yields a list of ratings which are not already present in the trainset.

All the ratings where user is known and item is know, but rating for (user, item) is not present in the trainset.

Yields:Iterable[Tuple[int, int, float]] – A list of tuples (uid, iid, global_mean)
Return type:Iterable[Tuple[int, int, float]]
recommend(user_id, recommendations_count=20)[source]¶

Returns a top recommendation_count recommendations for specific user.

Parameters:
  • user_id (int) – Id of the user.
  • recommendations_count (int, optional) – Defaults to 10. Specifies how many recommendations to return.
Raises:

UntrainedModelError – Raised when method is used before model is trained.
Returns:

book_id: estimated_rating pairs
Return type:

Dict[int, float]
test(ratings)[source]¶

Tests the model on the given ground-truth dataset.

Parameters:ratings (List[Tuple[int, int, float]]) – (user_id, book_id, true_rating) tuples
Raises:UntrainedModelError – Raised when method is used before model is trained.
Returns:List of predictions with true and estimated ratings.
Return type:List[Prediction]
users¶

Returns iterator over users in training set.

Yields:Iterable[int] – Users iterator.
Return type:Iterable[int]
class booksuggest.models.cf_recommend_models.KNNRecommendationModel(input_filepath)[source]¶

Bases: booksuggest.models.cf_recommend_models.SurpriseBasedModel

Recommendation algorithm using the neighbor similarity.

train()[source]¶

Computes user and items similarities.

class booksuggest.models.cf_recommend_models.SlopeOneRecommendationModel(input_filepath)[source]¶

Bases: booksuggest.models.cf_recommend_models.SurpriseBasedModel

Recommendation algorithm using the SlopeOne algorithm.

train()[source]¶

Computes users average ratings based on common items.

class booksuggest.models.cf_recommend_models.SurpriseBasedModel(input_filepath)[source]¶

Bases: booksuggest.models.cf_recommend_models.ICfRecommendationModel

Base class for models, which use algorithms from Surprise package.

Parameters:input_filepath (str) – Filepath containing ratings data.
_trainset¶

Dataset used for model training.

Type:Trainset
_algorithm¶

Algorithm(defined in Surprise package) used by model.

Type:AlgoBase

All the ratings where user is known and item is know, but rating for (user, item) is not present in the trainset.

load_models module¶

Function used for loading recommendation models.

exception booksuggest.models.load_models.InvalidModelException[source]¶

Bases: Exception

Custom exception for handling model retrieval errors.

booksuggest.models.load_models.load_model(model_file_path)[source]¶

Loads the model specified stored in model_file_path

Parameters:model_file_path (str) – Path to a file containing recommendation model.
Raises:InvalidModelException – Raised when object does not implement ICbRecommendationModel or ICfRecommendationModel interface.
Returns:Recommendation model object.
Return type:IRecommendationModel

model_exceptions module¶

Exceptions regarding recommendation models.

exception booksuggest.models.model_exceptions.UnbuiltFeaturesError[source]¶

Bases: Exception

Error is thrown when the content analyzer are used before feature_building.

exception booksuggest.models.model_exceptions.UntrainedModelError[source]¶

Bases: Exception

Error is raised when a method is used using an untrained model.
